['Aft - Toward the rear or stern part of a ship.', 'Quarterdeck - The upper deck abaft (behind) the main mast on a sailing vessel, traditionally used for ceremonies and naval operations.', 'Starboard - The right-hand side of a ship when looking forward; opposite of port.', 'Port - The left-hand side of a ship when facing forward; where ships typically dock at ports.', 'Poop deck - A raised platform or upper deck on the after part of the vessel, often used as living quarters.', 'Stern - The rear part of a boat or ship.', 'Bow - The front or forepart of a boat or ship.', "Forecastle - The upper deck in the forward part of a sailing vessel; usually contains crew's accommodations and equipment.", 'Galley - A room on a ship where food is cooked, traditionally located amidships (the center section).', 'Bulwark - The outer wall or parapet that forms the side of a dock, harbor, etc., protecting against waves; also refers to the upper edge of the deck along the hull near the stern.', 'Helm - A steering device on the afterdeck (back) of a ship, which allows the helmsman to control and maneuver the vessel.', 'Mainsail - The largest sail abaft (behind) the foremast in a traditional square-rigged ship; typically located at the stern.', 'Boom - A horizontal pole extending from the mast, used to control sails and aid in navigation, usually positioned near the rear of the vessel.', 'Stern tube - The housing that holds the propeller shaft on a ship; situated towards the rear or stern part of the vessel.', 'Bilge - The lowest compartment inside a boat, where water accumulates and is drained off through bilge pumps; located at the bottom near the keel (near the centerline).', 'Rudder - A flat piece of material attached to the sternpost or transom that steers a vessel by redirecting water flow; positioned towards the rear, usually below the hull.', 'Transom - The flat vertical surface forming the stern of a ship; located at the after part (rear) of the boat where it meets the keel and hull.', "Sheer line - A curve in a vessel's deck that arcs upwards towards the sides, generally providing better visibility for crew on board; situated around the midship area but can also be found at the stern.", 'Forepeak tank - A storage compartment located amidships and near the forward or bow part of a ship; often used to store ballast water.', "Afterbody - The section of a vessel's hull that extends beyond the after end (rear); can also refer to additional structural components like stabilizers, which are typically found at the stern."]
